intro: Pimelea imbricata f. gracillima, commonly known as the slender bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, cylindrical inflorescences that resemble bottle brushes. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers appear in late winter to spring, attracting nectar-feeding birds and insects. The foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs.
